results.title: Folioscopes
results.brief_description: They’re called folioscopes in France and translate to ‘thumb cinema’ in German, but they’re best known as flipbooks. Popular since the 1860s, flipbooks have been used as promotional tools, cereal box prizes and artworks.

constellations_primary.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_primary.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

results.description: They’re called folioscopes in France and translate to ‘thumb cinema’ in German, but they’re best known as flipbooks. Images come to life when you rapidly flip through pages of sequential illustrations or photographs. Popular since the 1860s, flipbooks have been used as promotional tools, cereal box prizes and artworks. They have animated everything from boxing matches and erotic dances to political propaganda and cartoons.
description_for_label: They’re called folioscopes in France and translate to ‘thumb cinema’ in German, but they’re best known as flipbooks. Images come to life when you rapidly flip through pages of sequential illustrations or photographs. Popular since the 1860s, flipbooks have been used as promotional tools, cereal box prizes and artworks. They have animated everything from boxing matches and erotic dances to political propaganda and cartoons.

results.title: Zoetrope to Cinemascope
results.brief_description: Not only did Alex Stitt create the first 3D animated feature film with Abra Cadabra (1983) and animate some of Australia’s most iconic commercials, including ‘Life. Be in it’, he also taught kids through play with books like this one.

constellations_primary.name: Learning through play
constellations_primary.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

results.description: Not only did Alex Stitt create the first 3D animated feature film with Abra Cadabra (1983) and animate some of Australia’s most iconic commercials, including ‘Life. Be in it’, he also taught kids through play. In 1971, Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead established the Jigsaw Factory in the Melbourne suburb of Richmond. The space was designed for children to have ‘fun in learning’, and the company produced a range of posters, cut-outs, educational toys, puzzles, games and books like this one, Zoetrope to cinemascope, which taught children about the relationship between optical toys and cinema.
description_for_label: Not only did Alex Stitt create the first 3D animated feature film with Abra Cadabra (1983) and animate some of Australia’s most iconic commercials, including ‘Life. Be in it’, he also taught kids through play. In 1971, Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead established the Jigsaw Factory in the Melbourne suburb of Richmond. The space was designed for children to have ‘fun in learning’, and the company produced a range of posters, cut-outs, educational toys, puzzles, games and books like this one, Zoetrope to cinemascope, which taught children about the relationship between optical toys and cinema.
